title.raw: 卷五 孝安帝紀 Volume 5: Annals of Emperor Xiao'an

sentences.zh: 恭宗孝安皇帝諱祜，肅宗孫也。

translations.literal: Emperor Gongzong Xiaoan, whose personal name was Hu, was the grandson of Emperor Suzong.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaoan of Han, whose personal name was Hu, was the grandson of Emperor Zhang.

sentences.zh: 父清河孝王慶，母左姬。

translations.literal: His father was King Xiao of Qinghe Qing, his mother was Lady Zuo.
translations.idiomatic: His father was King Qing of Qinghe, and his mother was Lady Zuo.

sentences.zh: 帝自在邸第，數有神光照室，又有赤蛇盤於床笫之間。

translations.literal: The Emperor, while still in his residence, several times had divine light illuminating the room, and there was a red snake coiled between the bed curtains.
translations.idiomatic: While still in his residence, the future emperor was several times visited by divine light illuminating his room, and a red snake coiled between his bed curtains.

sentences.zh: 年十歲，好學《史書》，和帝稱之，數見禁中。

translations.literal: At age ten, he loved studying the History Books, Emperor He praised him, frequently summoned to the imperial residence.
translations.idiomatic: At age ten, he loved studying the historical books; Emperor He praised him and frequently summoned him to the imperial residence.

sentences.zh: 延平元年，慶始就國，鄧太后特詔留帝清河邸。

translations.literal: Yanping first year: Qing first took up residence in his kingdom, Empress Dowager Deng specially ordered to leave the Emperor in the Qinghe residence.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Yanping, King Qing first took up residence in his kingdom, but Empress Dowager Deng specially ordered that the emperor remain in the Qinghe residence.

sentences.zh: 八月，殤帝崩，太后與兄車騎將軍鄧騭定策禁中。

translations.literal: Eighth month: Emperor Shang passed away, the Empress Dowager together with her brother Charioteer General Deng Zhi determined the plan in the imperial residence.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, Emperor Shang passed away; the Empress Dowager, together with her brother General Deng Zhi, determined the succession plan in the imperial residence.

sentences.zh: 其夜，使騭持節，以王青蓋車迎帝，齋於殿中。

translations.literal: That night, sent Zhi holding the imperial seal, with the king's blue-canopied carriage welcomed the Emperor, purified in the hall.
translations.idiomatic: That night, she sent Deng Zhi with the imperial seal to welcome the emperor using the king's blue-canopied carriage; he purified himself in the hall.

sentences.zh: 皇太后御崇德殿，百官皆吉服，群臣陪位，引拜帝為長安侯。

translations.literal: The Empress Dowager attended in the Chongde Hall, all officials wore auspicious robes, the assembled ministers stood in attendance, led the Emperor to bow as Marquis of Chang'an.
translations.idiomatic: The Empress Dowager presided in the Chongde Hall; all officials wore auspicious robes and the assembled ministers stood in attendance as they led the emperor to bow and be appointed Marquis of Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 皇太后詔曰：『先帝聖德淑茂，早弃天下。

translations.literal: Empress Dowager edict said: 'The late Emperor's sage virtue was pure and flourishing, early abandoned the realm.
translations.idiomatic: The Empress Dowager issued an edict stating: 'The late Emperor's sage virtue was pure and flourishing, yet he abandoned the realm too early.'

sentences.zh: 朕奉皇帝，夙夜瞻仰日月，冀望成就。

translations.literal: I serve the emperor, early and late gaze up to the sun and moon, hoped for accomplishment.
translations.idiomatic: I serve as regent for the emperor, gazing constantly at the sun and moon, hoping for his accomplishments.

sentences.zh: 豈意卒然顛沛，天年不遂，悲痛斷心。

translations.literal: How could I have expected sudden upheaval, heavenly years not fulfilled, sorrow and pain break the heart.
translations.idiomatic: Who could have expected this sudden upheaval, with his heavenly lifespan not fulfilled? The sorrow and pain break my heart.

sentences.zh: 朕惟平原王素被痼疾，念宗廟之重，思繼嗣之統，唯長安侯祜質性忠孝，小心翼翼，能通《詩》、《論》，篤學樂古，仁惠愛下。

translations.literal: I consider that King Pingyuan has long suffered from chronic illness, mindful of the ancestral temples' weight, think of the succession's continuity, only Marquis of Chang'an Hu has a nature of loyalty and filial piety, careful and cautious, able to comprehend the Poetry and Discourses, devoted to study and delight in antiquity, benevolent and gracious, loving the people below.
translations.idiomatic: I consider that King Pingyuan has long suffered from chronic illness. Mindful of the importance of the ancestral temples and thinking of the continuity of succession, only the Marquis of Chang'an Hu possesses a loyal and filial nature, is careful and cautious, comprehends the Poetry and Discourses, is devoted to study and delights in antiquity, and is benevolent and gracious toward the people.

sentences.zh: 年已十三，有成人之志。

translations.literal: Already thirteen years old, has the aspirations of an adult.
translations.idiomatic: Already thirteen years old, he has the aspirations of an adult.

sentences.zh: 親德係後，莫宜於祜。

translations.literal: Kinship virtue continues afterward, none more suitable than Hu.
translations.idiomatic: In terms of kinship virtue continuing the succession, none is more suitable than Hu.

sentences.zh: 《禮》「昆弟之子猶己子」；

translations.literal: The Rituals say 'A brother's son is like one's own son';
translations.idiomatic: As the Rituals say, 'A brother's son is like one's own son';

sentences.zh: 《春秋》之義，為人後者為之子，不以父命辭王父命。

translations.literal: The meaning of the Spring and Autumn Annals: one who succeeds another becomes his son, does not decline the grandfather's command because of the father's command.
translations.idiomatic: According to the Spring and Autumn Annals, one who succeeds another becomes his son; he does not decline the grandfather's command because of the father's command.

sentences.zh: 其以祜為孝和皇帝嗣，奉承祖宗，案禮儀奏。』

translations.literal: Let Hu become the heir of Emperor Xiaohe, serve and support the ancestors, according to ritual and ceremony present.''
translations.idiomatic: Let Hu become the heir of Emperor Xiaohe, to serve and support the ancestors; present this according to ritual and ceremony.''

sentences.zh: 又作策命曰：『惟延平元年秋八月癸丑，皇太后曰：咨長安侯祜：孝和皇帝懿德巍巍，光於四海；

translations.literal: Moreover composed an investiture edict saying: 'In Yanping first year, autumn, eighth month, Guiyou day, the Empress Dowager said: We consult Marquis of Chang'an Hu: Emperor Xiaohe's excellent virtue towers high, shines upon the four seas;
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, an investiture edict was composed stating: 'In the Yanping first year, autumn, eighth month, on the Guiyou day, the Empress Dowager said: We consult the Marquis of Chang'an Hu: Emperor Xiaohe's excellent virtue towers high and shines upon the four seas;'

sentences.zh: 大行皇帝不永天年。

translations.literal: the recently departed Emperor did not fulfill his heavenly years.
translations.idiomatic: the recently departed Emperor did not fulfill his heavenly lifespan.

sentences.zh: 朕惟侯孝章帝世嫡皇孫，謙恭慈順，在孺而勤，宜奉郊廟，承統大業。

translations.literal: I consider that the Marquis is Emperor Zhang's legitimate grandson by direct descent, modest and respectful, compassionate and obedient, diligent even in youth, suitable to serve the suburban altars and ancestral temples, inherit the great enterprise.
translations.idiomatic: I consider that the Marquis is Emperor Zhang's legitimate grandson by direct descent; he is modest and respectful, compassionate and obedient, diligent even in youth; he is suitable to serve the suburban altars and ancestral temples, and inherit the great enterprise.

sentences.zh: 今以侯嗣孝和皇帝後。

translations.literal: Now with the Marquis succeeding as Emperor Xiaohe's heir.
translations.idiomatic: Now the Marquis shall succeed as Emperor Xiaohe's heir.

sentences.zh: 其審君漢國，允執其中。

translations.literal: Let him carefully rule the Han state, faithfully hold to the mean.
translations.idiomatic: Let him carefully rule the Han state, faithfully holding to the mean.

sentences.zh: 「一人有慶，萬民賴之。」

translations.literal: 'When one person has good fortune, the ten thousand people rely upon it.'
translations.idiomatic: 'When one person has good fortune, the ten thousand people rely upon it.'

sentences.zh: 皇帝其勉之哉！』

translations.literal: Emperor, let him strive for it!''
translations.idiomatic: Emperor, let him strive for it!''

sentences.zh: 讀策畢，太尉奉上璽綬，即皇帝位，年十三。

translations.literal: Finished reading the edict, the Grand Marshal presented the seal and tassels, ascended the imperial throne, aged thirteen.
translations.idiomatic: After the edict was read, the Grand Marshal presented the seal and tassels; he ascended the imperial throne at age thirteen.

sentences.zh: 太后猶臨朝。

translations.literal: The Empress Dowager still held court.
translations.idiomatic: The Empress Dowager still held court.

sentences.zh: 九月庚子，謁高廟。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Gengzi day: Paid respects at the High Temple.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengzi day of the ninth month, he paid respects at the High Temple.

sentences.zh: 辛丑，謁光武廟。

translations.literal: Xinyou day: Paid respects at the Guangwu Temple.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinyou day, he paid respects at the Guangwu Temple.

sentences.zh: 六州大水。

translations.literal: Six provinces experienced major flooding.
translations.idiomatic: Six provinces suffered major flooding.

sentences.zh: 己未，遣謁者分行虛實，舉灾害，賑乏絕。

translations.literal: Jiyi day: Dispatched palace attendants to separately inspect the true conditions, report disasters, relieve the destitute and orphaned.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiyi day, palace attendants were dispatched to separately inspect the true conditions, report disasters, and provide relief to the destitute and orphaned.

sentences.zh: 丙寅，葬孝殤皇帝於康陵。

translations.literal: Bingyin day: Buried Emperor Shang in Kangling.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingyin day, Emperor Shang was buried in Kangling.

sentences.zh: 乙亥，隕石於陳留。

translations.literal: Yihai day: A meteor fell in Chenliu.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yihai day, a meteor fell in Chenliu.

sentences.zh: 西域諸國叛，攻都護任尚，遣副校尉梁慬救尚，擊破之。

translations.literal: The various kingdoms of the Western Regions rebelled, attacked Protector General Ren Shang, dispatched Vice Colonel Liang Quan to rescue Shang, defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: The various kingdoms of the Western Regions rebelled and attacked Protector General Ren Shang; Vice Colonel Liang Quan was dispatched to rescue Shang and defeated them.

sentences.zh: 冬十月，四州大水，雨雹。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month: Four provinces experienced major flooding, rain and hail.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter, four provinces suffered major flooding with rain and hail.

sentences.zh: 詔以宿麥不下，賑賜貧人。

translations.literal: Imperial edict because the stored wheat did not sprout, relieve and grant to poor people.
translations.idiomatic: By imperial edict, because the stored wheat did not sprout, relief was granted to the poor people.

sentences.zh: 十二月甲子，清河王薨，使司空持節吊祭，車騎將軍鄧騭護喪事。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, Jiazi day: King Qing of Qinghe passed away, sent the Minister of Works holding the imperial seal to offer condolences and sacrifices, Charioteer General Deng Zhi oversaw the funeral affairs.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiazi day of the twelfth month, King Qing of Qinghe passed away; the Minister of Works was sent with the imperial seal to offer condolences and sacrifices, while General Deng Zhi oversaw the funeral affairs.

sentences.zh: 乙酉，罷魚龍曼延百戲。

translations.literal: Yiyou day: Abolished the fish-dragon, slow-moving, hundred entertainments.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yiyou day, the fish-dragon and other elaborate entertainments were abolished.

sentences.zh: 永初元年春正月癸酉朔，大赦天下。

translations.literal: Yongchu first year, spring, first month, Guiyou first day: Great amnesty throughout the realm.
translations.idiomatic: On the first day of the first month of spring in the first year of Yongchu, a general amnesty was granted throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 蜀郡徼外羌內屬。

translations.literal: Shuguo frontier Qiang submitted internally.
translations.idiomatic: The Qiang tribes beyond the frontiers of Shuguo commandery submitted to Han rule.

sentences.zh: 戊寅，分犍為南部為屬國都尉。

translations.literal: Wuyin day: Divided Jianwei southern part into Dependent State Colonel.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuyin day, the southern part of Jianwei was divided to establish a Dependent State Colonel.

sentences.zh: 稟司隸、兗、豫、徐、冀、幷州貧民。

translations.literal: Provided grain to the poor people of Silu, Yan, Yu, Xu, Ji, Bing provinces.
translations.idiomatic: Grain was provided to the poor people of the provinces of Silu, Yan, Yu, Xu, Ji, and Bing.

sentences.zh: 二月丙午，以廣成遊獵地及被灾郡國公田假與貧民。

translations.literal: Second month, Bingwu day: With Guangcheng hunting grounds and disaster-affected commanderies and kingdoms' public fields loaned to poor people.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingwu day of the second month, the Guangcheng hunting grounds and public fields of disaster-affected commanderies and kingdoms were loaned to the poor people.

sentences.zh: 丁卯，分清河國封帝弟常保為廣川王。

translations.literal: Dingmao day: Divided Qinghe kingdom to enfeoff the Emperor's younger brother Changbao as King of Guangchuan.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingmao day, territory was divided from the Qinghe kingdom to enfeoff the emperor's younger brother Changbao as King of Guangchuan.

sentences.zh: 庚午，司徒梁鮪薨。

translations.literal: Gengwu day: Minister of the Masses Liang Wei passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengwu day, Minister of the Masses Liang Wei passed away.

sentences.zh: 三月癸酉，日有食之，詔公卿內外眾官、郡國守、相，舉賢良方正、有道術之士，明政術、達古今、能直言極諫者，各一人。

translations.literal: Third month, Guiyou day: There was an eclipse of the sun, imperial edict to the dukes and ministers, inner and outer officials, commandery and kingdom governors and chancellors, recommend worthy and upright, possessing the way and arts gentlemen, understanding governance methods, comprehending ancient and modern, able to speak frankly and remonstrate extremely, each one person.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guiyou day of the third month, there was a solar eclipse; by imperial edict, the dukes and ministers, inner and outer officials, and the governors and chancellors of commanderies and kingdoms were ordered to recommend worthy and upright gentlemen who possess the way and arts, understand governance methods, comprehend ancient and modern affairs, and are able to speak frankly and remonstrate forcefully—each recommending one person.

sentences.zh: 己卯，永昌徼外僬僥種夷貢獻內屬。

translations.literal: Jimao day: Yongchang frontier Jiaoao tribal Yi presented tribute and submitted internally.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jimao day, the Jiaoao tribal Yi beyond the frontiers of Yongchang commandery presented tribute and submitted to Han rule.

sentences.zh: 甲申，葬清河孝王，贈龍旗、虎賁。

translations.literal: Jiashen day: Buried King Xiao of Qinghe, granted dragon banner, tiger valiants.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiashen day, King Xiao of Qinghe was buried and posthumously granted a dragon banner and tiger valiants.

sentences.zh: 夏五月甲戌，長樂衛尉魯恭為司徒。

translations.literal: Summer, fifth month, Jiaxu day: ChangLe Guards Colonel Lu Gong became Minister of the Masses.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiaxu day of the fifth month of summer, Lu Gong, Guards Colonel of ChangLe, became Minister of the Masses.

sentences.zh: 丁丑，詔封北海王睦孫壽光侯普為北海王。

translations.literal: Dingchou day: Imperial edict enfeoffed King Mu of Beihai's grandson Marquis Pu of Shouguang as King of Beihai.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingchou day, by imperial edict, Pu, grandson of King Mu of Beihai and Marquis of Shouguang, was enfeoffed as King of Beihai.

sentences.zh: 九真徼外夜郎蠻夷舉土內屬。

translations.literal: Jiuzhen frontier Yelang barbarian Yi submitted their lands internally.
translations.idiomatic: The Yelang barbarian Yi beyond the frontiers of Jiuzhen commandery submitted their territories and submitted to Han rule.

sentences.zh: 六月戊申，爵皇太后母陰氏為新野君。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Wushen day: Ennobled the Empress Dowager's mother Yin clan as Lady of Xinye.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wushen day of the sixth month, the Empress Dowager's mother of the Yin clan was ennobled as Lady of Xinye.

sentences.zh: 丁巳，河東地陷。

translations.literal: Dingsi day: Hedong ground collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingsi day, the ground in Hedong collapsed.

sentences.zh: 壬戌，罷西域都護。

translations.literal: Renxu day: Abolished the Western Regions Protector General.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renxu day, the Protector General of the Western Regions was abolished.

sentences.zh: 先零種羌叛，斷隴道，大為寇掠，遣車騎將軍鄧騭、征西校尉任尚討之。

translations.literal: Xianling tribe Qiang rebelled, cut off Long road, greatly became bandits and plunderers, dispatched Charioteer General Deng Zhi, Western Conquest Colonel Ren Shang to attack them.
translations.idiomatic: The Xianling tribe of Qiang rebelled, cut off the Long road, and became major bandits and plunderers; Charioteer General Deng Zhi and Western Conquest Colonel Ren Shang were dispatched to attack them.

sentences.zh: 丁卯，赦除諸羌相連結謀叛逆者罪。

translations.literal: Dingmao day: Pardoned and exempted the crimes of all Qiang who mutually connected and plotted rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingmao day, all Qiang tribes who had conspired together in rebellion were pardoned and their crimes exempted.

sentences.zh: 秋九月庚午，詔三公明申舊令，禁奢侈，無作浮巧之物，殫財厚葬。

translations.literal: Autumn, ninth month, Gengwu day: Imperial edict to the Three Dukes to clearly proclaim old commands, prohibit extravagance, do not make frivolous clever objects, exhaust wealth on thick burials.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengwu day of the ninth month of autumn, an imperial edict to the Three Dukes ordered them to clearly proclaim the old commands: prohibit extravagance, do not make frivolous clever objects, and do not exhaust wealth on lavish burials.

sentences.zh: 是日，太尉徐防免。

translations.literal: On this day, Grand Marshal Xu Fang was dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On this day, Grand Marshal Xu Fang was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 辛未，司空尹勤免。

translations.literal: Xinwei day: Minister of Works Yin Qin was dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinwei day, Minister of Works Yin Qin was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 癸酉，調楊州五郡租米，贍給東郡、濟陰、陳留、梁國、下邳、山陽。

translations.literal: Guiyou day: Transferred Yangzhou five commanderies' tax rice, to provide for Dongjun, Jiyin, Chenliu, Liangguo, Xiapi, Shanyang.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guiyou day, tax rice from the five commanderies of Yangzhou was transferred to provide for Dongjun, Jiyin, Chenliu, Liangguo, Xiapi, and Shanyang.

sentences.zh: 丁丑，詔曰：『自今長吏被考竟未報，自非父母喪，無故輒去職者，劇縣十歲、平縣五歲以上，乃得次用。』

translations.literal: Dingchou day: Imperial edict said: 'From now on, senior officials who have been examined but report not yet returned, except for parents' mourning, those who without reason arbitrarily leave office, difficult counties ten years, ordinary counties five years above, then may be sequentially employed.''
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingchou day, an imperial edict stated: 'From now on, senior officials who have been examined but whose reports have not yet been returned—except for the mourning of parents—those who arbitrarily leave office without reason: for difficult counties, ten years or more; for ordinary counties, five years or more; only then may they be sequentially employed.''

sentences.zh: 壬午，詔太僕、少府減黃門鼓吹，以補羽林士；

translations.literal: Renwu day: Imperial edict to the Grand Master of the Horse, Lesser Treasury reduce Yellow Gate drum and horn music, to supplement the YuLin soldiers;
translations.idiomatic: On the Renwu day, an imperial edict ordered the Grand Master of the Horse and the Lesser Treasury to reduce the Yellow Gate drum and horn music to supplement the YuLin soldiers;

sentences.zh: 廄馬非乘輿常所御者，皆減半食；

translations.literal: stable horses not those the imperial carriage constantly used, all reduce half feed;
translations.idiomatic: all horses in the stables not used by the imperial carriage were to have their feed reduced by half;

sentences.zh: 諸所造作，非供宗廟園陵之用，皆且止。

translations.literal: all constructions made, not for supplying ancestral temples and tombs' use, all temporarily stop.
translations.idiomatic: all construction projects not for supplying the ancestral temples and tombs were to be temporarily halted.

sentences.zh: 丙戌，詔死罪以下及亡命贖，各有差。

translations.literal: Bingxu day: Imperial edict that death penalties below and fugitive redemption, each have gradations.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingxu day, an imperial edict ordered that penalties below the death sentence and redemption for fugitives be graduated according to circumstances.

sentences.zh: 庚寅，太傅張禹為太尉，太常周章為司空。

translations.literal: Gengyin day: Grand Tutor Zhang Yu became Grand Marshal, Grand Minister of Ceremonies Zhou Zhang became Minister of Works.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengyin day, Zhang Yu, Grand Tutor, became Grand Marshal, and Zhou Zhang, Grand Minister of Ceremonies, became Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 冬十月，倭國遣使奉獻。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month: Wa kingdom dispatched envoys to present tribute.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter, the Wa kingdom dispatched envoys to present tribute.

sentences.zh: 辛酉，新城山泉水大出。

translations.literal: Xinyou day: Xincheng mountain spring water greatly emerged.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinyou day, spring water greatly emerged from Xincheng mountain.

sentences.zh: 十一月丁亥，司空周章密謀廢立，策免，自殺。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Dinghai day: Minister of Works Zhou Zhang secretly plotted to depose and establish, was dismissed by edict, committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dinghai day of the eleventh month, Minister of Works Zhou Zhang secretly plotted to depose the emperor and establish another; he was dismissed by imperial edict and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 戊子，勑司隸校尉、冀、幷二州刺史：『民訛言相驚，弃捐舊居，老弱相攜，窮困道路。

translations.literal: Wuzi day: Ordered the Capital District Colonel, Ji, Bing two provinces' Governors: 'The people rumor words mutually startling, abandon and discard old dwellings, old and weak mutually carrying, impoverished and exhausted on the roads.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuzi day, orders were given to the Capital District Colonel and the Governors of Ji and Bing provinces: 'The people, startled by rumors, have abandoned their old dwellings; the old and weak carry each other and are impoverished and exhausted on the roads.

sentences.zh: 其各勑所部長吏，躬親曉喻。

translations.literal: Let each order their subordinate senior officials, personally explain and enlighten.
translations.idiomatic: Each should order their subordinate senior officials to personally explain and enlighten them.

sentences.zh: 若欲歸本郡，在所為封長檄；

translations.literal: If they wish to return to their home commandery, at the location issue sealed long proclamations;
translations.idiomatic: If they wish to return to their home commanderies, issue sealed long proclamations at the locations;

sentences.zh: 不欲，勿強。』

translations.literal: if not desired, do not force.''
translations.idiomatic: if not desired, do not force them.''

sentences.zh: 十二月乙卯，潁川太守張敏為司空。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, Yimao day: Yingchuan Governor Zhang Min became Minister of Works.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yimao day of the twelfth month, Zhang Min, Governor of Yingchuan, became Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 是歲，郡國十八地震；

translations.literal: This year, commanderies and kingdoms eighteen earthquakes;
translations.idiomatic: This year, there were eighteen earthquakes in the commanderies and kingdoms;

sentences.zh: 四十一雨水，或山水暴至；

translations.literal: forty-one rain waters, or mountain waters violently arrived;
translations.idiomatic: there were forty-one instances of flooding, or mountain waters that violently arrived;

sentences.zh: 二十八大風，雨雹。

translations.literal: twenty-eight great winds, rain and hail.
translations.idiomatic: there were twenty-eight great winds with rain and hail.

sentences.zh: 二年春正月，稟河南、下邳、東萊、河內貧民。

translations.literal: Second year, spring, first month: Provided grain to the poor people of Henan, Xiapi, Donglai, HeNei.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring of the second year, grain was provided to the poor people of Henan, Xiapi, Donglai, and HeNei.

sentences.zh: 車騎將軍鄧騭為種羌所敗於冀西。

translations.literal: Charioteer General Deng Zhi was defeated by the Seed Qiang in Ji west.
translations.idiomatic: Charioteer General Deng Zhi was defeated by the Seed Qiang in the west of Ji province.

sentences.zh: 二月乙丑，遣光祿大夫樊準、呂倉分行冀、兗二州，稟貸流民。

translations.literal: Second month, Yichou day: Dispatched Grand Master of the Palace Fan Zhun, Lu Cang to separately tour Ji, Yan two provinces, provide grain and lend to displaced people.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yichou day of the second month, Grand Master of the Palace Fan Zhun and Lu Cang were dispatched to separately tour Ji and Yan provinces to provide grain and loans to the displaced people.

sentences.zh: 夏四月甲寅，漢陽城中火，燒殺三千五百七十人。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, JiaYin day: Hanyang city fire, burned and killed three thousand five hundred seventy people.
translations.idiomatic: On the JiaYin day of the fourth month of summer, a fire in Hanyang city burned and killed three thousand five hundred and seventy people.

sentences.zh: 五月，旱。

translations.literal: Fifth month: Drought.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, there was drought.

sentences.zh: 丙寅，皇太后幸洛陽寺及若廬獄，錄囚徒，賜河南尹、廷尉、卿及官屬以下各有差，即日降雨。

translations.literal: Bingyin day: The Empress Dowager visited Luoyang temples and the Rulu prison, examined prisoners, granted the Henan Director, Court Minister, ministers and officials below each graded amounts, on the same day rain fell.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingyin day, the Empress Dowager visited the Luoyang temples and the Rulu prison, examined the prisoners, and granted graded amounts to the Henan Director, Court Minister, ministers, and subordinate officials; rain fell on the same day.

sentences.zh: 六月，京師及郡國四十大水，大風，雨雹。

translations.literal: Sixth month: Capital and commanderies kingdoms forty major floods, great winds, rain and hail.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, there were forty major floods in the capital and commanderies/kingdoms, with great winds and rain and hail.

sentences.zh: 秋七月戊辰，詔曰：『昔在帝王，承天理民，莫不據璇機玉衡，以齊七政。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Wuchen day: Imperial edict said: 'Formerly in emperors and kings, receiving heaven governing the people, none did not base on the Jade Balance to align the seven administrations.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuchen day of the seventh month of autumn, an imperial edict stated: 'Former emperors and kings, in receiving heaven and governing the people, all based themselves on the Jade Balance to align the seven administrations.

sentences.zh: 朕以不德，遵奉大業，而陰陽差越，變異並見，萬民飢流，羌貊叛戾。

translations.literal: I through lack of virtue, continue to uphold the great enterprise, yet yin and yang are displaced, anomalies appear together, ten thousand people starve and flow away, Qiang and Mo rebel and are perverse.
translations.idiomatic: Through my lack of virtue, I continue to uphold the great enterprise, yet yin and yang are displaced, anomalies appear together, the people starve and become displaced, and the Qiang and Mo rebel and are perverse.

sentences.zh: 夙夜克己，憂心京京。

translations.literal: From morning to night I restrain myself, anxious heart greatly.
translations.idiomatic: From morning to night I restrain myself, my anxious heart greatly troubled.

sentences.zh: 間令公卿郡國舉賢良方正，遠求博選，開不諱之路，冀得至謀，以鑒不逮，而所對皆循尚浮言，無卓爾異聞。

translations.literal: Recently commanded the dukes and ministers commanderies and kingdoms recommend worthy and upright, distant seeking broad selection, open the path of not avoiding taboos, hoped to obtain supreme plans, to examine shortcomings, yet all responses only follow and esteem empty words, no outstanding different reports.
translations.idiomatic: Recently I commanded the dukes and ministers and commanderies and kingdoms to recommend the worthy and upright through distant seeking and broad selection, to open the path of not avoiding taboos, hoping to obtain supreme plans to examine my shortcomings; yet all responses only follow and esteem empty words, with no outstanding different reports.

sentences.zh: 其百僚及郡國吏人，有道術明習灾異陰陽之度璇機之數者，各使指變以聞。

translations.literal: Let the hundred officials and commanderies kingdoms officials and people, those possessing the way and arts clearly versed in disasters anomalies yin yang measures Jade Balance numbers, each make them point out changes and report.
translations.idiomatic: Let the officials and people of the commanderies and kingdoms who possess the way and arts and are clearly versed in the measures of disasters, anomalies, yin, yang, and the Jade Balance numbers each point out the changes and report them.

sentences.zh: 二千石長吏明以詔書，博衍幽隱，朕將親覽，待以不次，冀獲嘉謀，以承天誡。』

translations.literal: Two thousand shi senior officials clearly proclaim with the edict, broadly derive obscure hidden matters, I will personally examine, treat with extraordinary promotion, hope to obtain good plans, to receive heaven's warnings.''
translations.idiomatic: Let the senior officials of two thousand shi clearly proclaim this edict, broadly deriving obscure and hidden matters; I will personally examine them and treat them with extraordinary promotion, hoping to obtain good plans to receive heaven's warnings.''

sentences.zh: 閏月辛丑，廣川王常保薨，無子，國除。

translations.literal: Intercalary month, Xinchou day: King Changbao of Guangchuan passed away, no son, kingdom abolished.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinchou day of the intercalary month, King Changbao of Guangchuan passed away; having no son, his kingdom was abolished.

sentences.zh: 癸未，蜀郡徼外羌舉土內屬。

translations.literal: Guiwei day: Shuguo frontier Qiang submitted their lands internally.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guiwei day, the Qiang beyond the frontiers of Shuguo commandery submitted their territories and came under Han rule.

sentences.zh: 九月庚子，詔王國官屬墨綬下至郎、謁者，其經明任博士，居鄉里有廉清孝順之稱、才任理人者，國相歲移名，與計偕上尚書，公府通調，令得外補。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Gengzi day: Imperial edict to kingdom officials black sashes down to attendants and messengers, those versed in classics and appointed as Erudites, dwelling in villages having reputation for incorruptible purity filial obedience, talent suitable for governing people, kingdom chancellors yearly shift names, with accounts together present to the Masters of Writing, public offices jointly transfer, enable them to be externally appointed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengzi day of the ninth month, an imperial edict to the officials of kingdoms, from those with black sashes down to attendants and messengers, stated that those versed in the classics and appointed as Erudites, dwelling in villages with reputations for incorruptible purity and filial obedience, whose talents suit them for governing people: the kingdom chancellors should yearly submit their names, present them together with the accounts to the Masters of Writing, and let the public offices jointly transfer them so they may be appointed externally.

sentences.zh: 冬十月庚寅，稟濟陰、山陽、玄菟貧民。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month, Gengyin day: Provided grain to the poor people of Jiyin, Shanyang, Xuanyu.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengyin day of the tenth month of winter, grain was provided to the poor people of Jiyin, Shanyang, and Xuanyu.

sentences.zh: 征西校尉任尚與先零羌戰于平襄，尚軍敗績。

translations.literal: Western Conquest Colonel Ren Shang battled with Xianling Qiang at Pingxiang, Shang's army suffered defeat.
translations.idiomatic: Western Conquest Colonel Ren Shang battled with the Xianling Qiang at Pingxiang, where his army suffered defeat.

sentences.zh: 十一月辛酉，拜鄧騭為大將軍，徵還京師，留任尚屯隴右。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Xinyou day: Appointed Deng Zhi as Grand General, summoned back to the capital, left Ren Shang to encamp in Long right.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinyou day of the eleventh month, Deng Zhi was appointed Grand General and summoned back to the capital, while Ren Shang was left to encamp in Longxi province.

sentences.zh: 先零羌滇零稱天子於北地，遂寇三輔，東犯趙、魏，南入益州，殺漢中太守董炳。

translations.literal: Xianling Qiang Dianling proclaimed himself emperor in Beidi, then invaded the Three Adjuncts, east violated Zhao, Wei, south entered Yizhou, killed Hanzhong Governor Dong Bing.
translations.idiomatic: The Xianling Qiang leader Dianling proclaimed himself emperor in Beidi, then invaded the Three Adjuncts, violated Zhao and Wei to the east, entered Yizhou to the south, and killed Governor Dong Bing of Hanzhong.

sentences.zh: 十二月辛卯，稟東郡、鉅鹿、廣陽、安定、定襄、沛國貧民。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, Xinmao day: Provided grain to the poor people of Dongjun, Julu, Guangyang, Anding, Dingxiang, Peiguo.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinmao day of the twelfth month, grain was provided to the poor people of Dongjun, Julu, Guangyang, Anding, Dingxiang, and Peiguo.

sentences.zh: 廣漢塞外參狼羌降，分廣漢北部為屬國都尉。

translations.literal: Guanghan frontier Canlang Qiang surrendered, divided Guanghan northern part into Dependent State Colonel.
translations.idiomatic: The Canlang Qiang beyond the Guanghan frontier surrendered; the northern part of Guanghan was divided to establish a Dependent State Colonel.

sentences.zh: 是歲，郡國十二地震。

translations.literal: This year, commanderies and kingdoms twelve earthquakes.
translations.idiomatic: This year, there were twelve earthquakes in the commanderies and kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 三年春正月庚子，皇帝加元服。

translations.literal: Third year, spring, first month, Gengzi day: The Emperor assumed the cap of manhood.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengzi day of the first month of spring in the third year, the Emperor assumed the cap of manhood.

sentences.zh: 大赦天下。

translations.literal: Great amnesty throughout the realm.
translations.idiomatic: A general amnesty was granted throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 賜王、主、貴人、公、卿以下金帛各有差；

translations.literal: Granted kings, princesses, noble ladies, dukes, ministers and below gold and silk each graded amounts;
translations.idiomatic: Kings, princesses, noble ladies, dukes, ministers and below were granted gold and silk in graded amounts;

sentences.zh: 男子為父後，及三老、考悌、力田爵，人二級，流民欲占者人一級。

translations.literal: men who succeed as heirs to fathers, and Three Elders, filial and brotherly, diligent farmers ranks, each person two levels, displaced people desiring to register each person one level.
translations.idiomatic: men who succeed as heirs to their fathers, as well as the Three Elders, the filial and brotherly, and diligent farmers, were advanced two ranks each; displaced people desiring to register were advanced one rank each.

sentences.zh: 遣騎都尉任仁討先零羌，不利，羌遂破沒臨洮。

translations.literal: Dispatched Cavalry Colonel Ren Ren to attack Xianling Qiang, unfavorable, Qiang then broke and captured Lintao.
translations.idiomatic: Cavalry Colonel Ren Ren was dispatched to attack the Xianling Qiang, but met with unfavorable results; the Qiang then broke through and captured Lintao.

sentences.zh: 高句驪遣使貢獻。

translations.literal: Goguryeo dispatched envoys to present tribute.
translations.idiomatic: Goguryeo dispatched envoys to present tribute.

sentences.zh: 三月，京師大飢，民相食。

translations.literal: Third month: Capital greatly famished, people ate each other.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, great famine struck the capital, and people ate each other.

sentences.zh: 壬辰，公卿詣闕謝。

translations.literal: Rencheng day: Dukes and ministers went to the palace gate to apologize.
translations.idiomatic: On the Rencheng day, the dukes and ministers went to the palace gate to apologize.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：『朕以幼沖，奉承鴻業，不能宣流風化，而感逆陰陽，至令百姓飢荒，更相噉食。

translations.literal: Imperial edict said: 'I through youthful inexperience, upholding the great enterprise, cannot spread and flow moral transformation, yet have provoked reversal of yin and yang, to the extent that the common people starve and are desolate, mutually devour each other.
translations.idiomatic: An imperial edict stated: 'Through youthful inexperience, I uphold the great enterprise but cannot spread moral transformation; instead, I have provoked the reversal of yin and yang, to the extent that the common people starve and are desolate, devouring each other.

sentences.zh: 永懷悼歎，若墜淵水。

translations.literal: Eternally cherish mourning and sighing, as if fallen into deep waters.
translations.idiomatic: I eternally cherish mourning and sighing, as if fallen into deep waters.

sentences.zh: 咎在朕躬，非群司之責，而過自貶引，重朝廷之不德。

translations.literal: Blame is in my person, not the responsibility of the assembled officials, yet the fault self-deprecatingly accepts, doubles the court's lack of virtue.
translations.idiomatic: The blame lies with my person, not with the assembled officials; yet I self-deprecatingly accept the fault, which doubles the court's lack of virtue.

sentences.zh: 其務思變復，以助不逮。』

translations.literal: Let them diligently think of change and return, to aid shortcomings.''
translations.idiomatic: Let them diligently think of change and return, to aid my shortcomings.''

sentences.zh: 癸巳，詔以鴻池假與貧民。

translations.literal: Guisi day: Imperial edict to loan the Hongchi to poor people.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guisi day, by imperial edict, the Hongchi was loaned to the poor people.

sentences.zh: 壬寅，司徒魯恭免。

translations.literal: RenYin day: Minister of the Masses Lu Gong dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the RenYin day, Minister of the Masses Lu Gong was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 夏四月丙寅，大鴻臚九江夏勤為司徒。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Bingyin day: Grand Herald of Nine Rivers Xia Qin became Minister of the Masses.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingyin day of the fourth month of summer, Xia Qin, Grand Herald of Nine Rivers, became Minister of the Masses.

sentences.zh: 三公以國用不足，奏令吏人入錢穀，得為關內侯、虎賁羽林郎、五大夫、官府吏、緹騎、營士各有差。

translations.literal: Three Dukes because state expenditures insufficient, memorialized ordering officials and people to contribute money and grain, obtained becoming Gentlemen of the Passes, Tiger Valiants YuLin Attendants, Five Chief Gentlemen, official bureau scribes, red horsemen, camp soldiers each graded.
translations.idiomatic: Because state expenditures were insufficient, the Three Dukes memorialized ordering officials and people to contribute money and grain, by which they could become Gentlemen of the Passes, Tiger Valiants and YuLin Attendants, Five Chief Gentlemen, official bureau scribes, red horsemen, and camp soldiers, each according to their contributions.

sentences.zh: 己巳，詔上林、廣成苑可墾闢者，賦與貧民。

translations.literal: Jisi day: Imperial edict that Shanglin, Guangcheng gardens arable openable areas, assign to poor people.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jisi day, by imperial edict, the arable areas in the Shanglin and Guangcheng gardens were assigned to the poor people.

sentences.zh: 甲申，清河王虎威薨。

translations.literal: Jiashen day: King Huwei of Qinghe passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiashen day, King Huwei of Qinghe passed away.

sentences.zh: 五月丙申，封樂安王寵子延平為清河王。

translations.literal: Fifth month, BingShen day: Enfeoffed King Chong of Le'an's son Yanping as King of Qinghe.
translations.idiomatic: On the BingShen day of the fifth month, Yanping, son of King Chong of Le'an, was enfeoffed as King of Qinghe.

sentences.zh: 丁酉，沛王正薨。

translations.literal: Dingyou day: King Zheng of Pei passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingyou day, King Zheng of Pei passed away.

sentences.zh: 癸丑，京師大風。

translations.literal: GuiChou day: Capital great wind.
translations.idiomatic: On the GuiChou day, a great wind struck the capital.

sentences.zh: 六月，烏桓寇代郡、上谷、涿郡。

translations.literal: Sixth month: Wuhuan invaded Dai commandery, Shanggu, Zhuojun.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, the Wuhuan invaded Dai commandery, Shanggu, and Zhuojun.

sentences.zh: 秋七月，海賊張伯路等寇略緣海九郡，遣侍御史龐雄督州、郡兵討破之。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month: Sea bandits Zhang Bolu and others invaded and plundered nine commanderies along the sea, dispatched Palace Attendant Censor Pang Xiong to supervise provincial and commandery troops to attack and defeat them.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of autumn, sea bandits led by Zhang Bolu invaded and plundered nine commanderies along the coast; Palace Attendant Censor Pang Xiong was dispatched to supervise provincial and commandery troops to attack and defeat them.

sentences.zh: 庚子，詔長吏案行在所，皆令種宿麥蔬食，務盡地力，其貧者給種餉。

translations.literal: Gengzi day: Imperial edict to senior officials to inspect and tour their locations, all ordered to plant stored wheat and vegetable foods, diligently exhaust the land's strength, the poor ones given seed and provisions.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengzi day, an imperial edict ordered senior officials to inspect their jurisdictions and commanded them all to plant stored wheat and vegetable crops, diligently exhausting the land's productivity; seed and provisions were to be given to the poor.

sentences.zh: 九月，鴈門烏桓及鮮卑叛，敗五原郡兵於高渠谷。

translations.literal: Ninth month: Yanmen Wuhuan and Xianbei rebelled, defeated Wuyuan commandery troops at Gaoqu Valley.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, the Yanmen Wuhuan and Xianbei rebelled, defeating Wuyuan commandery troops at Gaoqu Valley.

sentences.zh: 冬十月，南單于叛，圍中郎將耿种於美稷。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month: Southern Chanyu rebelled, surrounded Colonel Protector Geng Zhong at Meiji.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter, the Southern Chanyu rebelled and surrounded Colonel Protector Geng Zhong at Meiji.

sentences.zh: 十一月，遣行車騎將軍何熙討之。

translations.literal: Eleventh month: Dispatched Acting Charioteer General He Xi to attack them.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Acting Charioteer General He Xi was dispatched to attack them.

sentences.zh: 十二月辛酉，郡國九地震。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, Xinyou day: Commanderies and kingdoms nine earthquakes.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinyou day of the twelfth month, there were nine earthquakes in the commanderies and kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 乙亥，有星孛於天苑。

translations.literal: Yihai day: There was a sweeping star in the Celestial Enclosure.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yihai day, there was a sweeping star in the Celestial Enclosure.

sentences.zh: 是歲，京師及郡國四十一雨水雹。

translations.literal: This year, capital and commanderies kingdoms forty-one rain waters hail.
translations.idiomatic: This year, there were forty-one instances of flooding and hail in the capital and commanderies/kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 幷、涼二州大饑，人相食。

translations.literal: Bing, Liang two provinces great famine, people ate each other.
translations.idiomatic: Great famine struck the provinces of Bing and Liang, and people ate each other.

sentences.zh: 四年春正月元日，會，徹樂，不陳充庭車。

translations.literal: Fourth year, spring, first month, first day: Assembly, withdrew music, did not display the filling courtyard carriages.
translations.idiomatic: On the first day of the first month of spring in the fourth year, there was an assembly; music was withdrawn, and the filling courtyard carriages were not displayed.

sentences.zh: 辛卯，詔以三輔比遭寇亂，人庶流冗，除三年逋租、過更、口筭、芻稾；

translations.literal: Xinmao day: Imperial edict because the Three Adjuncts recently suffered bandit chaos, people numerous displaced and scattered, exempted three years' arrears taxes, excess labor service, head tallies, fodder and straw;
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinmao day, by imperial edict, because the Three Adjuncts had recently suffered bandit chaos and many people were displaced, three years' arrears in taxes, excess labor service, head tallies, and fodder and straw were exempted;

sentences.zh: 稟上郡貧民各有差。

translations.literal: provided grain to Shangjun poor people each graded.
translations.idiomatic: grain was provided to the poor people of Shangjun in graded amounts.

sentences.zh: 海賊張伯路復與勃海、平原劇賊劉文河、周文光等攻厭次，殺縣令，遣御史中丞王宗督青州刺史法雄討破之。

translations.literal: Sea bandit Zhang Bolu again with Bohai, Pingyuan fierce bandits Liu Wenhe, Zhou Wenguang and others attacked Yanci, killed county magistrate, dispatched Palace Secretary Wang Zong to supervise Qingzhou Governor Fa Xiong to attack and defeat them.
translations.idiomatic: Sea bandit Zhang Bolu again joined with fierce bandits Liu Wenhe, Zhou Wenguang and others from Bohai and Pingyuan to attack Yanci, killing the county magistrate; Palace Secretary Wang Zong was dispatched to supervise Qingzhou Governor Fa Xiong to attack and defeat them.

sentences.zh: 度遼將軍梁慬、遼東太守耿夔討破南單于於屬國故城。

translations.literal: Liao-crossing General Liang Quan, Liaodong Governor Geng Kui attacked and defeated Southern Chanyu at Dependent State old city.
translations.idiomatic: Liao-crossing General Liang Quan and Liaodong Governor Geng Kui attacked and defeated the Southern Chanyu at the old city of the Dependent State.

sentences.zh: 丙午，詔減百官及州、郡、縣奉各有差。

translations.literal: Bingwu day: Imperial edict to reduce the stipends of all officials and provincial, commandery, county officials each graded.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingwu day, an imperial edict reduced the stipends of all officials and provincial, commandery, and county officials in graded amounts.

sentences.zh: 二月丁巳，稟九江貧民。

translations.literal: Second month, Dingsi day: Provided grain to Jiujiang poor people.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingsi day of the second month, grain was provided to the poor people of Jiujiang.

sentences.zh: 南匈奴寇常山。

translations.literal: Southern Xiongnu invaded Changshan.
translations.idiomatic: The Southern Xiongnu invaded Changshan.

sentences.zh: 乙丑，初置長安、雍二營都尉官。

translations.literal: Yichou day: Initially established the offices of Chang'an and Yong two camp colonels.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yichou day, the offices of Colonel of the Chang'an and Yong camps were initially established.

sentences.zh: 乙亥，詔自建初以來，諸祅言它過坐徙邊者，各歸本郡；

translations.literal: Yihai day: Imperial edict that since Jianchu, all who spoke ill omens and other faults punished by banishment to the border, each return to their home commandery;
translations.idiomatic: On the Yihai day, an imperial edict ordered that since the Jianchu period, all who had been punished by banishment to the border for speaking ill omens and other faults should each return to their home commanderies;

sentences.zh: 其沒入官為奴婢者，免為庶人。

translations.literal: those confiscated into official service as male and female slaves, exempted to become commoners.
translations.idiomatic: those who had been confiscated into official service as slaves were exempted and became commoners.

sentences.zh: 詔謁者劉珍及《五經》博士，校定東觀《五經》、諸子、傳記、百家蓺術，整齊脫誤，是正文字。

translations.literal: Imperial edict to Palace Attendant Liu Zhen and the Five Classics Erudites, to collate and determine the Eastern Gallery Five Classics, various philosophers, biographies, hundred schools arts, arrange omissions and errors, correct the characters.
translations.idiomatic: By imperial edict, Palace Attendant Liu Zhen and the Five Classics Erudites were ordered to collate and determine the Five Classics, various philosophers, biographies, and hundred schools arts in the Eastern Gallery, to arrange omissions and errors, and correct the characters.

sentences.zh: 三月，南單于降。

translations.literal: Third month: Southern Chanyu surrendered.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, the Southern Chanyu surrendered.

sentences.zh: 先零羌寇褒中，漢中太守鄭勤戰歿。

translations.literal: Xianling Qiang invaded Baozhong, Hanzhong Governor Zheng Qin died in battle.
translations.idiomatic: The Xianling Qiang invaded Baozhong; Hanzhong Governor Zheng Qin died in battle.

sentences.zh: 徙金城郡都襄武。

translations.literal: Relocated Jincheng commandery capital to Xiangwu.
translations.idiomatic: The capital of Jincheng commandery was relocated to Xiangwu.

sentences.zh: 戊子，杜陵園火。

translations.literal: Wuzi day: Duling park fire.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuzi day, there was a fire in Duling park.

sentences.zh: 癸巳，郡國九地震。

translations.literal: Guisi day: Commanderies and kingdoms nine earthquakes.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guisi day, there were nine earthquakes in the commanderies and kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，六州蝗。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month: Six provinces locusts.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, six provinces suffered locust infestations.

sentences.zh: 丁丑，大赦天下。

translations.literal: Dingchou day: Great amnesty throughout the realm.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingchou day, a general amnesty was granted throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 秋七月乙酉，三郡大水。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Yiyou day: Three commanderies major flooding.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yiyou day of the seventh month of autumn, three commanderies suffered major flooding.

sentences.zh: 己卯，騎都尉任仁下獄死。

translations.literal: Jimao day: Cavalry Colonel Ren Ren imprisoned and died.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jimao day, Cavalry Colonel Ren Ren was imprisoned and died.

sentences.zh: 九月甲申，益州郡地震。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Jiashen day: Yizhou commandery earthquake.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiashen day of the ninth month, there was an earthquake in Yizhou commandery.

sentences.zh: 冬十月甲戌，新野君陰氏薨，使司空持節護喪事。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month, Jiaxu day: Lady of Xinye Yin clan passed away, sent the Minister of Works holding the imperial seal to oversee the funeral affairs.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiaxu day of the tenth month of winter, Lady Yin of Xinye passed away; the Minister of Works was sent with the imperial seal to oversee the funeral affairs.

sentences.zh: 大將軍鄧騭罷。

translations.literal: Grand General Deng Zhi dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: Grand General Deng Zhi was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 五年春正月庚辰朔，日有食之。

translations.literal: Fifth year, spring, first month, Gengchen first day: There was an eclipse of the sun.
translations.idiomatic: On the first day of the first month of spring in the fifth year, there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: 丙戌，郡國十地震。

translations.literal: Bingxu day: Commanderies and kingdoms ten earthquakes.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingxu day, there were ten earthquakes in the commanderies and kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 己丑，太尉張禹免。

translations.literal: Jichou day: Grand Marshal Zhang Yu dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jichou day, Grand Marshal Zhang Yu was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 甲申，光祿勳李脩為太尉。

translations.literal: Jiashen day: Grand Master of the Palace Li Xiu became Grand Marshal.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiashen day, Li Xiu, Grand Master of the Palace, became Grand Marshal.

sentences.zh: 二月丁卯，詔省減郡國貢獻太官口食，先零羌寇河東，遂至河內。

translations.literal: Second month, Dingmao day: Imperial edict to reduce commanderies and kingdoms' contributions to the Grand Provisioner's rations, Xianling Qiang invaded Hedong, then reached HeNei.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingmao day of the second month, an imperial edict ordered the reduction of commanderies' and kingdoms' contributions to the Grand Provisioner's rations; the Xianling Qiang invaded Hedong and then reached HeNei.

sentences.zh: 三月，詔隴西徙襄武，安定徙美陽，北地徙池陽，上郡徙衙。

translations.literal: Third month: Imperial edict that Longxi relocate to Xiangwu, Anding relocate to Meiyang, Beidi relocate to Chiyang, Shangjun relocate to Ting.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, by imperial edict, Longxi was to relocate to Xiangwu, Anding to Meiyang, Beidi to Chiyang, and Shangjun to Ting.

sentences.zh: 夫餘夷犯塞，殺傷吏人。

translations.literal: Fuyu Yi violated the frontier, killed and wounded officials and people.
translations.idiomatic: The Fuyu Yi violated the frontier, killing and wounding officials and people.

sentences.zh: 閏月丁酉，赦涼州河西四郡。

translations.literal: Intercalary month, Dingyou day: Pardoned Liangzhou Hexi four commanderies.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingyou day of the intercalary month, the four commanderies of Hexi in Liangzhou were pardoned.

sentences.zh: 戊戌，詔曰：『朕以不德，奉郊廟，承大業，不能興和降善，為人祈福。

translations.literal: Wuxu day: Imperial edict said: 'I through lack of virtue, serve the suburban altars and ancestral temples, uphold the great enterprise, cannot promote harmony and bring down goodness, pray for blessings for the people.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuxu day, an imperial edict stated: 'Through my lack of virtue, I serve the suburban altars and ancestral temples and uphold the great enterprise, but I cannot promote harmony and bring down goodness to pray for blessings for the people.

sentences.zh: 災異蜂起，寇賊縱橫，夷狄猾夏，戎事不息，百姓匱乏，疲於徵發。

translations.literal: Disasters and anomalies swarm rising, bandits and rebels run rampant, Yi and Di harass Xia, military affairs do not cease, common people destitute and lacking, exhausted by conscription.
translations.idiomatic: Disasters and anomalies swarm like bees, bandits and rebels run rampant, the Yi and Di harass the Xia, military affairs never cease, the common people are destitute and lacking, exhausted by conscription.

sentences.zh: 重以蝗蟲滋生，害及成麥，秋稼方收，甚可悼也。

translations.literal: Moreover with locusts multiplying, harming the mature wheat, autumn crops just harvesting, very lamentable.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, locusts have multiplied and harmed the mature wheat; the autumn crops are just being harvested—it is very lamentable.

sentences.zh: 朕以不明，統理失中，亦未獲忠良以毗闕政。

translations.literal: I through lack of clarity, governing and managing lost the mean, also have not obtained loyal and good ministers to assist in the court government.
translations.idiomatic: Through my lack of clarity, I have lost the mean in governing and managing, and have also not obtained loyal and good ministers to assist in court government.

sentences.zh: 傳曰：「顛而不扶，危而不持，則將焉用彼相矣。」

translations.literal: The Tradition says: 'Fallen and not support, endangered and not hold, then what use that minister?'
translations.idiomatic: As the Tradition says: 'If something is fallen and you do not support it, endangered and you do not hold it, then what use is that minister?'

sentences.zh: 公卿大夫將何以匡救，濟斯艱戹，承天誡哉？

translations.literal: Dukes and ministers, grandees, how will you rectify and save, aid these difficulties and hardships, receive heaven's warnings?
translations.idiomatic: Dukes and ministers, grandees, how will you rectify and save us, aid these difficulties and hardships, and receive heaven's warnings?

sentences.zh: 蓋為政之本，莫若得人，褒賢顯善，聖制所先。

translations.literal: Indeed the root of governing, nothing better than obtaining people, praise the worthy make manifest the good, sage institutions place first.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, the root of governing is nothing better than obtaining the right people; praising the worthy and making the good manifest—these are what the sage institutions place first.

sentences.zh: 「濟濟多士，文王以寧」。

translations.literal: 'Abundant many scholars, King Wen thereby peaceful.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Abundant are the many scholars; thereby King Wen was at peace.'

sentences.zh: 思得忠良正直之臣，以輔不逮。

translations.literal: Think to obtain loyal good upright ministers, to assist shortcomings.
translations.idiomatic: I seek to obtain loyal, good, and upright ministers to assist my shortcomings.

sentences.zh: 其令三公、特進、侯、中二千石、二千石、郡守、諸侯相舉賢良方正、有道術、達於政化、能直言極諫之士各一人，及至孝與眾卓異者，并遣詣公車，朕將親覽焉。』

translations.literal: Let the Three Dukes, Special Advancers, marquises, middle two thousand shi, two thousand shi, commandery governors, kingdom chancellors recommend worthy upright, possessing the way and arts, versed in governance transformation, able to speak frankly and remonstrate extremely scholars each one person, and utmost filial and outstanding different from the crowd, all dispatch to the public carriage, I will personally examine them.''
translations.idiomatic: Let the Three Dukes, Special Advancers, marquises, middle two thousand shi officials, two thousand shi officials, commandery governors, and kingdom chancellors each recommend one worthy and upright scholar who possesses the way and arts, is versed in governance and transformation, and is able to speak frankly and remonstrate forcefully, as well as those who are supremely filial and outstandingly different from the crowd; all shall be dispatched to the public carriage, and I will personally examine them.''

sentences.zh: 六月甲辰，樂成王巡薨。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Jiachen day: King Xun of Lecheng passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiachen day of the sixth month, King Xun of Lecheng passed away.

sentences.zh: 秋七月己巳，詔三公、特進、九卿、校尉，舉列將子孫明曉戰陳任將帥者。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Jisi day: Imperial edict to the Three Dukes, Special Advancers, Nine Ministers, Colonels, recommend ranking generals' descendants clearly versed in battle formations suitable for generalship.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jisi day of the seventh month of autumn, an imperial edict to the Three Dukes, Special Advancers, Nine Ministers, and Colonels ordered them to recommend descendants of ranking generals who are clearly versed in battle formations and suitable for generalship.

sentences.zh: 九月，漢陽人杜琦、王信叛，與先零諸種羌攻陷上邽城。

translations.literal: Ninth month: Hanyang people Du Qi, Wang Xin rebelled, with Xianling various tribes Qiang attacked and captured Shanggui city.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, Du Qi and Wang Xin of Hanyang rebelled; together with the various Xianling Qiang tribes, they attacked and captured Shanggui city.

sentences.zh: 十二月，漢陽太守趙博遣客刺殺杜琦。

translations.literal: Twelfth month: Hanyang Governor Zhao Bo sent a guest assassin to kill Du Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, Hanyang Governor Zhao Bo sent an assassin to kill Du Qi.

sentences.zh: 是歲，九州蝗，郡國八雨水。

translations.literal: This year, nine provinces locusts, commanderies and kingdoms eight flooding.
translations.idiomatic: This year, there were locusts in nine provinces and flooding in eight commanderies and kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 六年春正月庚申，詔越巂置長利、高望、始昌三苑，又令益州郡置萬歲苑，犍為置漢平苑。

translations.literal: Sixth year, spring, first month, Gengshen day: Imperial edict that Yuexi establish Changli, Gaowang, Shichang three gardens, moreover order Yizhou commandery establish Wansui garden, Jianwei establish Hanping garden.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengshen day of the first month of spring in the sixth year, an imperial edict ordered Yuexi to establish the Changli, Gaowang, and Shichang gardens, and further ordered Yizhou commandery to establish the Wansui garden and Jianwei to establish the Hanping garden.

sentences.zh: 三月，十州蝗。

translations.literal: Third month: Ten provinces locusts.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, ten provinces suffered locust infestations.

sentences.zh: 夏四月乙丑，司空張敏罷。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Yichou day: Minister of Works Zhang Min dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yichou day of the fourth month of summer, Minister of Works Zhang Min was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 己卯，太常劉愷為司空。

translations.literal: Jimao day: Grand Minister of Ceremonies Liu Kai became Minister of Works.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jimao day, Liu Kai, Grand Minister of Ceremonies, became Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 五月，旱。

translations.literal: Fifth month: Drought.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, there was drought.

sentences.zh: 丙寅，詔令中二千石下至黃綬，一切復秩還贖，賜爵各有差。

translations.literal: Bingyin day: Imperial edict ordered middle two thousand shi down to yellow sashes, all restore ranks return redemption payments, grant nobility ranks each graded.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingyin day, an imperial edict ordered that all officials from middle two thousand shi down to those with yellow sashes should have their ranks restored and redemption payments returned, with nobility ranks granted in graded amounts.

sentences.zh: 戊辰，皇太后幸雒陽寺，錄囚徒，理冤獄。

translations.literal: Wuchen day: The Empress Dowager visited Luoyang temples, examined prisoners, rectified unjust cases.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuchen day, the Empress Dowager visited the Luoyang temples, examined the prisoners, and rectified unjust cases.

sentences.zh: 六月壬辰，豫章、員谿、原山崩。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Rencheng day: Yuzhang, Yuanxi, Yuan mountains collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Rencheng day of the sixth month, the mountains in Yuzhang, Yuanxi, and Yuan collapsed.

sentences.zh: 辛巳，大赦天下。

translations.literal: Xinsi day: Great amnesty throughout the realm.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinsi day, a general amnesty was granted throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 遣侍御史唐喜討漢陽賊王信，破斬之。

translations.literal: Dispatched Palace Attendant Censor Tang Xi to attack Hanyang bandit Wang Xin, defeated and beheaded him.
translations.idiomatic: Palace Attendant Censor Tang Xi was dispatched to attack the Hanyang bandit Wang Xin; he defeated and beheaded him.

sentences.zh: 冬十一月辛丑，護烏桓校尉吳祉下獄死。

translations.literal: Winter, eleventh month, Xinchou day: Protector Wuhuan Colonel Wu Zhi imprisoned and died.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinchou day of the eleventh month of winter, Protector Wuhuan Colonel Wu Zhi was imprisoned and died.

sentences.zh: 是歲，先零羌滇零死，子零昌復襲偽號。

translations.literal: This year, Xianling Qiang Dianling died, son Lingchang again assumed the false title.
translations.idiomatic: This year, the Xianling Qiang leader Dianling died; his son Lingchang again assumed the false title.

sentences.zh: 七年春正月庚戌，皇太后率大臣命婦謁宗廟。

translations.literal: Seventh year, spring, first month, Gengxu day: The Empress Dowager led ministers and noble ladies to pay respects at the ancestral temples.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengxu day of the first month of spring in the seventh year, the Empress Dowager led the ministers and noble ladies to pay respects at the ancestral temples.

sentences.zh: 二月丙午，郡國十八地震。

translations.literal: Second month, Bingwu day: Commanderies and kingdoms eighteen earthquakes.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingwu day of the second month, there were eighteen earthquakes in the commanderies and kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 夏四月乙未，平原王勝薨。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Yiwei day: King Sheng of Pingyuan passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yiwei day of the fourth month of summer, King Sheng of Pingyuan passed away.

sentences.zh: 丙申晦，日有食之。

translations.literal: Bingshen last day: There was an eclipse of the sun.
translations.idiomatic: On the last day of the month (Bingshen), there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: 五月庚子，京師大雩。

translations.literal: Fifth month, Gengzi day: Capital great prayer for rain.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengzi day of the fifth month, a great prayer for rain was held in the capital.

sentences.zh: 秋，護羌校尉侯霸、騎都尉馬賢破先零羌。

translations.literal: Autumn: Protector Qiang Colonel Hou Ba, Cavalry Colonel Ma Xian defeated Xianling Qiang.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, Protector Qiang Colonel Hou Ba and Cavalry Colonel Ma Xian defeated the Xianling Qiang.

sentences.zh: 八月丙寅，京師大風，蝗蟲飛過洛陽。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Bingyin day: Capital great wind, locusts flew over Luoyang.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingyin day of the eighth month, a great wind struck the capital, and locusts flew over Luoyang.

sentences.zh: 詔賜民爵。

translations.literal: Imperial edict granted nobility ranks to the people.
translations.idiomatic: By imperial edict, nobility ranks were granted to the people.

sentences.zh: 郡國被蝗傷稼十五以上，勿收今年田租；

translations.literal: Commanderies and kingdoms harmed by locusts damaging crops fifteen percent above, do not collect this year's field taxes;
translations.idiomatic: For commanderies and kingdoms where locusts damaged crops by fifteen percent or more, this year's field taxes were not to be collected;

sentences.zh: 不滿者，以實除之。

translations.literal: those not reaching it, according to the actual amount exempt them.
translations.idiomatic: for those not reaching this level, taxes were exempted according to the actual damage.

sentences.zh: 九月，調零陵、桂陽、豫章、會稽租米，賑給南陽、廣陵、下邳、彭城、山陽、廬江、九江饑民；

translations.literal: Ninth month: Transferred Lingling, Guiyang, Yuzhang, Kuaiji tax rice, to relieve Nanyang, Guangling, Xiapi, Pengcheng, Shanyang, Lujiang, Jiujiang famine people;
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, tax rice was transferred from Lingling, Guiyang, Yuzhang, and Kuaiji to relieve the famine-stricken people of Nanyang, Guangling, Xiapi, Pengcheng, Shanyang, Lujiang, and Jiujiang;

sentences.zh: 又調濱水縣榖輸敖倉。

translations.literal: moreover transferred riverside counties' grain to be delivered to Ao granary.
translations.idiomatic: moreover, grain from riverside counties was transferred and delivered to the Ao granary.

sentences.zh: 元初元年春正月甲子，改元元初。

translations.literal: Yuanchu first year, spring, first month, Jiazi day: Changed the era name to Yuanchu.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiazi day of the first month of spring in the first year of Yuanchu, the era name was changed to Yuanchu.

sentences.zh: 賜民爵，人二級，孝悌、力田人三級，爵過公乘，得移與子若同產、同產子，民脫無名數及流民欲占者人一級；

translations.literal: Granted nobility ranks to the people, each person two levels, filial fraternal, diligent farmers each person three levels, nobility ranks exceeding public charioteer, may transfer to son or same father, same father's son, people freed from unregistered taxes and displaced people desiring to register each person one level;
translations.idiomatic: Nobility ranks were granted to the people, two levels each; filial and fraternal people and diligent farmers received three levels each; for those whose nobility ranks exceeded public charioteer, they could transfer the excess to their sons or siblings; freed people and displaced people desiring to register received one level each;

sentences.zh: 鰥、寡、孤、獨、篤癃貧不能自存者穀，人三斛；

translations.literal: widowers, widows, orphans, solitaries, severely disabled poor unable to support themselves grain, each person three dou;
translations.idiomatic: widowers, widows, orphans, solitaries, and severely disabled poor people unable to support themselves received three dou of grain each;

sentences.zh: 貞婦帛，人一匹。

translations.literal: chaste women silk, each person one bolt.
translations.idiomatic: chaste women received one bolt of silk each.

sentences.zh: 二月己卯，日南地坼。

translations.literal: Second month, Jimao day: Rinan ground split.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jimao day of the second month, the ground in Rinan split.

sentences.zh: 三月癸酉，日有食之。

translations.literal: Third month, Guiyou day: There was an eclipse of the sun.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guiyou day of the third month, there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: 夏四月丁酉，大赦天下。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Dingyou day: Great amnesty throughout the realm.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingyou day of the fourth month of summer, a general amnesty was granted throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 京師及郡國五旱、蝗。

translations.literal: Capital and commanderies kingdoms five drought, locusts.
translations.idiomatic: There were drought and locusts in five commanderies and kingdoms, including the capital.

sentences.zh: 詔三公、特進、列侯、中二千石、二千石、郡守舉敦厚質直者，各一人。

translations.literal: Imperial edict to the Three Dukes, Special Advancers, ranked marquises, middle two thousand shi, two thousand shi, commandery governors recommend sincere and upright ones, each one person.
translations.idiomatic: By imperial edict, the Three Dukes, Special Advancers, ranked marquises, middle two thousand shi officials, two thousand shi officials, and commandery governors were ordered to recommend sincere and upright individuals, one each.

sentences.zh: 五月，先零羌寇雍城。

translations.literal: Fifth month: Xianling Qiang invaded Yongcheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, the Xianling Qiang invaded Yongcheng.

sentences.zh: 六月丁巳，河東地陷。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Dingsi day: Hedong ground collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingsi day of the sixth month, the ground in Hedong collapsed.

sentences.zh: 秋七月，蜀郡夷寇蠶陵，殺縣令。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month: Shuguo Yi invaded Canling, killed the county magistrate.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of autumn, the Shuguo Yi invaded Canling and killed the county magistrate.

sentences.zh: 九月乙丑，太尉李脩罷。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Yichou day: Grand Marshal Li Xiu dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yichou day of the ninth month, Grand Marshal Li Xiu was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 先零羌寇武都、漢中，絕隴道。

translations.literal: Xianling Qiang invaded Wudu, Hanzhong, cut off the Long road.
translations.idiomatic: The Xianling Qiang invaded Wudu and Hanzhong, cutting off the Long road.

sentences.zh: 辛未，大司農山陽司馬苞為太尉。

translations.literal: Xinyou day: Grand Minister of Agriculture Shanyang Sima Bao became Grand Marshal.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinyou day, Sima Bao of Shanyang, Grand Minister of Agriculture, became Grand Marshal.

sentences.zh: 冬十月戊子朔，日有食之。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month, Wuzi first day: There was an eclipse of the sun.
translations.idiomatic: On the first day of the tenth month of winter (Wuzi), there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: 先零羌敗涼州刺史皮陽於狄道。

translations.literal: Xianling Qiang defeated Liangzhou Governor Pi Yang at Didao.
translations.idiomatic: The Xianling Qiang defeated Liangzhou Governor Pi Yang at Didao.

sentences.zh: 乙卯，詔除三輔三歲田租、更賦、口筭。

translations.literal: Yimao day: Imperial edict exempted the Three Adjuncts three years' field taxes, labor service, head tallies.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yimao day, by imperial edict, the Three Adjuncts were exempted from three years of field taxes, labor service, and head tallies.

sentences.zh: 十一月。

translations.literal: Eleventh month.
translations.idiomatic: Eleventh month.

sentences.zh: 是歲，郡國十五地震。

translations.literal: This year, commanderies and kingdoms fifteen earthquakes.
translations.idiomatic: This year, there were fifteen earthquakes in the commanderies and kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 二年春正月，詔稟三輔及幷、涼六郡流冗貧人。

translations.literal: Second year, spring, first month: Imperial edict provided grain to the displaced poor people of the Three Adjuncts and the six commanderies of Bing and Liang.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring of the second year, by imperial edict, grain was provided to the displaced poor people of the Three Adjuncts and the six commanderies of Bing and Liang.

sentences.zh: 蜀郡青衣道夷奉獻內屬。

translations.literal: Shuguo Qingyi road Yi presented tribute and submitted internally.
translations.idiomatic: The Yi of the Qingyi road in Shuguo presented tribute and submitted to Han rule.

sentences.zh: 修理西門豹所分漳水為支渠，以溉民田。

translations.literal: Repaired Ximen Bao's divided Zhang water into branch channels, to irrigate people's fields.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhang River channels divided by Ximen Bao were repaired to irrigate the people's fields.

sentences.zh: 二月戊戌，遣中謁者收葬京師客死無家屬及棺椁朽敗者，皆為設祭；

translations.literal: Second month, Wuxu day: Dispatched palace attendants to collect and bury those who died as guests in the capital without family and those whose coffins were rotten and broken, all were provided with sacrifices;
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuxu day of the second month, palace attendants were dispatched to collect and bury those who died as guests in the capital without family and those whose coffins had rotted and broken; sacrifices were provided for all;

sentences.zh: 其有家屬，尤貧無以葬者，賜錢人五千。

translations.literal: those with family, especially poor without means to bury, grant money each person five thousand.
translations.idiomatic: for those with family who were especially poor and without means to bury their dead, five thousand cash were granted to each person.

sentences.zh: 辛酉，詔三輔、河內、河東、上黨、趙國、太原各修理舊渠，通利水道，以溉公私田疇。

translations.literal: Xinyou day: Imperial edict that the Three Adjuncts, HeNei, Hedong, Shangdang, Zhao kingdom, Taiyuan each repair old canals, open beneficial water channels, to irrigate public and private fields.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinyou day, an imperial edict ordered that the Three Adjuncts, HeNei, Hedong, Shangdang, Zhao kingdom, and Taiyuan each repair their old canals and open beneficial water channels to irrigate public and private fields.

sentences.zh: 三月癸亥，京師大風。

translations.literal: Third month, Guihai day: Capital great wind.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guihai day of the third month, a great wind struck the capital.

sentences.zh: 先零羌寇益州，遣中郎將尹就討之。

translations.literal: Xianling Qiang invaded Yizhou, dispatched Colonel Protector Yin Jiu to attack them.
translations.idiomatic: The Xianling Qiang invaded Yizhou; Colonel Protector Yin Jiu was dispatched to attack them.

sentences.zh: 夏四月丙午，立貴人閻氏為皇后。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Bingwu day: Established Noble Lady Yan clan as Empress.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingwu day of the fourth month of summer, Noble Lady Yan was established as Empress.

sentences.zh: 五月，京師旱，河南及郡國十九蝗。

translations.literal: Fifth month: Capital drought, Henan and commanderies kingdoms nineteen locusts.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, there was drought in the capital and locusts in Henan and nineteen commanderies and kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 甲戌，詔曰：『朝廷不明，庶事失中，灾異不息，憂心悼懼。

translations.literal: Jiaxu day: Imperial edict said: 'The court lacks clarity, all affairs lose the mean, disasters and anomalies do not cease, anxious heart mourns and fears.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiaxu day, an imperial edict stated: 'The court lacks clarity, all affairs lose the mean, disasters and anomalies do not cease; my anxious heart mourns and fears.

sentences.zh: 被蝗以來，七年於茲，而州、郡隱匿，裁言頃畝。

translations.literal: Since being afflicted by locusts, seven years now, yet provinces and commanderies conceal, barely report qing and mu.
translations.idiomatic: Since being afflicted by locusts, seven years have now passed, yet the provinces and commanderies conceal the damage and barely report in qing and mu.

sentences.zh: 今群飛蔽天，為害廣遠，所言所見，寧相副邪？

translations.literal: Now swarms fly covering the sky, causing harm far and wide, what is said and seen, how can they correspond?
translations.idiomatic: Now swarms fly covering the sky, causing harm far and wide; what is said and seen—how can they possibly correspond?

sentences.zh: 三司之職，內外是監，即不奏聞，又無舉正。

translations.literal: Three Offices' duty is to supervise inner and outer, yet not memorialize to make known, moreover have no rectifications.
translations.idiomatic: The duty of the Three Offices is to supervise inner and outer affairs, yet they do not memorialize to make matters known and moreover have no rectifications.

sentences.zh: 天灾至重，欺罔辠大。

translations.literal: Heaven's disasters extremely heavy, deception crime great.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven's disasters are extremely heavy; the crime of deception is great.

sentences.zh: 今方盛夏，且復假貸，以觀厥後。

translations.literal: Now just flourishing summer, moreover again provide loans, to observe their future.
translations.idiomatic: Now that flourishing summer has just arrived, moreover provide loans again, to observe what follows.

sentences.zh: 其務消救灾眚，安輯黎元。』

translations.literal: Let them diligently eliminate and save from disaster blights, pacify and settle the black-haired people.''
translations.idiomatic: Let them diligently eliminate and save from disaster blights, pacify and settle the black-haired people.''

sentences.zh: 六月丙戌，太尉司馬苞薨。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Bingxu day: Grand Marshal Sima Bao passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingxu day of the sixth month, Grand Marshal Sima Bao passed away.

sentences.zh: 洛陽新城地裂。

translations.literal: Luoyang new city ground split.
translations.idiomatic: The ground split in Luoyang's new city.

sentences.zh: 秋七月辛巳，太僕太山馬英為太尉。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Xinsi day: Grand Master of the Horse Taishan Ma Ying became Grand Marshal.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinsi day of the seventh month of autumn, Ma Ying of Taishan, Grand Master of the Horse, became Grand Marshal.

sentences.zh: 八月，遼東鮮卑圍無慮縣。

translations.literal: Eighth month: Liaodong Xianbei surrounded Wulu county.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, the Liaodong Xianbei surrounded Wulu county.

sentences.zh: 九月，又攻夫犁營，殺縣令。

translations.literal: Ninth month: Again attacked Fuli camp, killed the county magistrate.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, they again attacked Fuli camp and killed the county magistrate.

sentences.zh: 壬午晦，日有食之。

translations.literal: Renwu last day: There was an eclipse of the sun.
translations.idiomatic: On the last day of the month (Renwu), there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: 冬十月，遣中郎將任尚屯三輔。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month: Dispatched Colonel Protector Ren Shang to encamp in the Three Adjuncts.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter, Colonel Protector Ren Shang was dispatched to encamp in the Three Adjuncts.

sentences.zh: 詔郡國中都官繫囚減死一等，勿笞，詣馮翊、扶風屯，妻子自隨，占著所在；

translations.literal: Imperial edict that commanderies and kingdoms' central prefectures' imprisoned prisoners reduce death penalty one level, do not cane, go to Pingyi, Fufeng encampments, wives and children follow themselves, register and settle at locations;
translations.idiomatic: By imperial edict, prisoners in commanderies' and kingdoms' central prefectures had their death penalties reduced by one level and were not to be caned; they were to go to the Pingyi and Fufeng encampments, with their wives and children following; they were to register and settle at the locations;

sentences.zh: 女子勿輸。

translations.literal: women do not transport.
translations.idiomatic: women were not to be transported.

sentences.zh: 亡命死辠以下贖，各有差。

translations.literal: fugitives death crimes below redemption, each graded.
translations.idiomatic: fugitives whose crimes were below the death penalty could redeem themselves, each according to gradations.

sentences.zh: 其吏人聚為盜賊，有悔過者，除其罪。

translations.literal: those officials and people who gathered as bandits and rebels, those who repent of their errors, exempt their crimes.
translations.idiomatic: for those officials and people who gathered as bandits and rebels, those who repented of their errors had their crimes exempted.

sentences.zh: 乙未，右扶風仲光、安定太守杜恢、京兆虎牙都尉耿溥與先零羌戰於丁奚城，光等大敗，並沒。

translations.literal: Yiyou day: Right Fufeng Zhong Guang, Anding Governor Du Hui, Jingzhao Tiger Tooth Colonel Geng Pu battled with Xianling Qiang at Dingxi city, Guang and others greatly defeated, all perished.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yiyou day, Zhong Guang of Right Fufeng, Governor Du Hui of Anding, and Tiger Tooth Colonel Geng Pu of Jingzhao battled with the Xianling Qiang at Dingxi city; Guang and the others suffered a great defeat and all perished.

sentences.zh: 左馮翊司馬鈞下獄，自殺。

translations.literal: Left Pingyi Sima Jun imprisoned, committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: Sima Jun of Left Pingyi was imprisoned and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 十一月庚申，郡國十地震。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Gengshen day: Commanderies and kingdoms ten earthquakes.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengshen day of the eleventh month, there were ten earthquakes in the commanderies and kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 十二月，武陵澧中蠻叛，州、郡擊破之。

translations.literal: Twelfth month: Wuling Lizhong barbarians rebelled, province and commandery attacked and defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, the Wuling Lizhong barbarians rebelled; the province and commandery attacked and defeated them.

sentences.zh: 己酉，司徒夏勤罷。

translations.literal: Jiyou day: Minister of the Masses Xia Qin dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiyou day, Minister of the Masses Xia Qin was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 庚戌，司空劉愷為司徒，光祿勳袁敞為司空。
